title: How 1,000 Ukraine Troops Entered 30 Km Into Russia, What They Plan Next
content: Ukrainian ground troops and mechanized forces crossed the international border, advancing over 30 kilometres into Russian territory in one of the most significant developments in the ongoing war between the two countries.
summary: Ukrainian ground troops and mechanized forces crossed the international border, advancing over 30 kilometres into Russian territory in one of the most significant developments in the ongoing war between the two countries.

title: Skydiving Student, Instructor In US Die After Hitting "Dust Devil"
content: A 28-year-old skydiving student in the United States was killed alongside her diving instructor after the pair hit a "dust devil" in California.
summary: A 28-year-old skydiving student in the United States was killed alongside her diving instructor after the pair hit a "dust devil" in California.

title: Opinion: Bangladesh's New Reality Doesn't Bode Well For India's Security
content: At a time when India sees itself as a leading global power, it cannot afford to ignore the challenges emanating from Bangladesh, its most important partner in South Asia.
summary: At a time when India sees itself as a leading global power, it cannot afford to ignore the challenges emanating from Bangladesh, its most important partner in South Asia.

title: Amid Fears Of Israel-Iran War, Air India's Latest Message For Fliers
content: Air India will not run flights to and from Tel Aviv amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the airlines said.
summary: Air India will not run flights to and from Tel Aviv amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the airlines said.

title: 5.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Tokyo After Japan Issues Megaquake Alert
content: A magnitude-5.3 earthquake hit Tokyo and surrounding areas on Friday evening, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, a day after the government issued a first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake on the country's Pacific coast.
summary: A magnitude-5.3 earthquake hit Tokyo and surrounding areas on Friday evening, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, a day after the government issued a first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake on the country's Pacific coast.

title: 10 Killed, 35 Wounded In Russian Strikes On Town In Eastern Ukraine
content: A Russian strike on a supermarket in the eastern Ukrainian town of Kostyantynivka on Friday killed at least 10 people and injured 35, Ukraine's interior minister said.
summary: A Russian strike on a supermarket in the eastern Ukrainian town of Kostyantynivka on Friday killed at least 10 people and injured 35, Ukraine's interior minister said.

title: UK Prime Minister Says Country On "High Alert" For More Far-Right Rallies
content: Police in England said Thursday that forces nationwide had now arrested nearly 500 people for alleged participation in the unrest that began on July 30, while around a dozen people were jailed on Thursday for involvement.
summary: Police in England said Thursday that forces nationwide had now arrested nearly 500 people for alleged participation in the unrest that began on July 30, while around a dozen people were jailed on Thursday for involvement.

title: Russia Moves Troops, Weapons After Ukraine Advances Into Border
content: Russia is moving army units with "BM-21 Grad multiple rocket launchers, towed artillery guns, tanks transported on trawls, heavy tracked vehicles, Ural and Kamaz trucks" to Kursk's Sudzhansky District, the defence ministry said.
summary: Russia is moving army units with "BM-21 Grad multiple rocket launchers, towed artillery guns, tanks transported on trawls, heavy tracked vehicles, Ural and Kamaz trucks" to Kursk's Sudzhansky District, the defence ministry said.

title: Iran Navy Unveils Advanced Missiles As Regional Tensions Spike
content: The Iranian Revolutionary Guards said on Friday that its navy has new cruise missiles equipped with highly explosive warheads that are undetectable, state media reported.
summary: The Iranian Revolutionary Guards said on Friday that its navy has new cruise missiles equipped with highly explosive warheads that are undetectable, state media reported.

title: Samsung Recalls 1 Million Stoves In US After Accidental Fires
content: Samsung is recalling more than one million electric stoves in the United States following reports of accidental fires that injured 40 people and killed pets, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission said Friday.
summary: Samsung is recalling more than one million electric stoves in the United States following reports of accidental fires that injured 40 people and killed pets, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission said Friday.

title: Female Inmates Beaten Inside Iran Prison: Jailed Nobel Winner's Family
content: Two prisoners "had heart palpitations due to the stress," but medical examinations determined that their general condition "is favourable," Iran's prison authority said.
summary: Two prisoners "had heart palpitations due to the stress," but medical examinations determined that their general condition "is favourable," Iran's prison authority said.

title: "Drunk" Egyptian Wrestler Arrested In Paris For Allegedly Groping Woman
content: French police early Friday arrested an Egyptian wrestler taking part in the Olympics over allegedly groping a woman in a bar, prosecutors said.
summary: French police early Friday arrested an Egyptian wrestler taking part in the Olympics over allegedly groping a woman in a bar, prosecutors said.

title: Layoffs Continue In US, Canada As Companies Uncertain Of Economy
content: Microsoft is cutting around 1,900 jobs at gaming divisions Activision Blizzard and Xbox.
summary: Microsoft is cutting around 1,900 jobs at gaming divisions Activision Blizzard and Xbox.

title: Rapper Travis Scott Arrested After Fight At 5-Star Hotel In Paris
content: US rapper Travis Scott was arrested early Friday over a fight at a five-star hotel in the French capital, prosecutors said.
summary: US rapper Travis Scott was arrested early Friday over a fight at a five-star hotel in the French capital, prosecutors said.

title: OpenAI Is A Bigger Threat To Google Than US Regulators
content: Google has long been synonymous with search, commanding around 90% of the global market share and bringing in about $175 billion in annual revenue through the business
summary: Google has long been synonymous with search, commanding around 90% of the global market share and bringing in about $175 billion in annual revenue through the business

title: Kamala Harris, Joe Biden To Make Their First Joint Campaign Trip
content: Kamala Harris and Joe Biden will next week make their first joint campaign trip since the US president's shock decision to drop out of the 2024 White House race against Donald Trump.
summary: Kamala Harris and Joe Biden will next week make their first joint campaign trip since the US president's shock decision to drop out of the 2024 White House race against Donald Trump.

title: Geometric Storms Expected To Hit Earth This Week, Power Grids At Risk
content: A series of potent solar events is expected to hit Earth, potentially causing significant geomagnetic storms over the next few days, NASA has said.
summary: A series of potent solar events is expected to hit Earth, potentially causing significant geomagnetic storms over the next few days, NASA has said.

title: Muhammad Yunus Honours Heroes, First Act As Bangladesh Interim Leader
content: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus led a solemn tribute to Bangladesh's fallen independence heroes in the first act of his interim government on Friday, after a student-led uprising forced predecessor Sheikh Hasina into exile.
summary: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus led a solemn tribute to Bangladesh's fallen independence heroes in the first act of his interim government on Friday, after a student-led uprising forced predecessor Sheikh Hasina into exile.

title: Indian-Origin Man Wrongly Jailed For 38 Years For Murders Dies In US Prison
content: Kris Maharaj was wrongly convicted in 1986 for the murders of Derrick and Duane Moo Young, and his death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment in 2002.
summary: Kris Maharaj was wrongly convicted in 1986 for the murders of Derrick and Duane Moo Young, and his death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment in 2002.

title: Teen ISIS Supporter Admits To Planning "Bloodbath" At Taylor Swift Concert
content: An Austrian teenager arrested over an alleged plot to strike a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna planned to carry out a suicide attack that would have caused a "bloodbath" and had vowed loyalty to Islamic State (IS), authorities said on Thursday.
summary: An Austrian teenager arrested over an alleged plot to strike a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna planned to carry out a suicide attack that would have caused a "bloodbath" and had vowed loyalty to Islamic State (IS), authorities said on Thursday.
